javaslang.concurrent

Interface Future<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the computation result.

    public interface Future<T>
    A Future is a computation result that becomes available at some point.

    A Future has three disjoint states: pending, completed, cancelled.

    • Pending: The computation is ongoing. Only a pending future may be cancelled.
    • Completed: The computation finished successfully with a result or failed with an exception.
    • Cancelled: A pending computation was cancelled. A cancelled Future will never reach the completed state.
    Callbacks man be registered on a Future at each point of time. These actions are performed as soon as the Future is completed. An action which is registered on a completed Future is immediately performed. The action may run on a separate Thread, depending on the underlying ExecutionService. Actions which are registered on a cancelled Future are never performed.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Daniel Dietrich

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static <T> Future<T> of(Try.CheckedSupplier<T> computation)
        Starts an asynchronous computation using the default ExecutorService ForkJoinPool.commonPool().
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the computation result.
        Parameters:
        computation - A computation.
        Returns:
        A new Future instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if computation is null.

      • of

        static <T> Future<T> of(ExecutorService executorService,
                        Try.CheckedSupplier<T> computation)
        Starts an asynchronous computation using the given ExecutorService.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the computation result.
        Parameters:
        executorService - An executor service.
        computation - A computation.
        Returns:
        A new Future instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of executorService of computation is null.

      • cancel

        boolean cancel()
        Cancels the Future. A pending Future may be interrupted, depending on the underlying ExecutionService.
        Returns:
        false, if the Future is already completed or cancelled, otherwise true.

      • getValue

        Option<Try<T>> getValue()
        Returns the value of the Future.
        Returns:
        None, if the Future is not yet completed or was cancelled, otherwise Some(Try).

      • isCancelled

        boolean isCancelled()
        Checks if the Future was cancelled.
        Returns:
        true, if the Future was cancelled, false otherwise.

      • isCompleted

        boolean isCompleted()
        Checks if the Future is completed, i.e. has a value.
        Returns:
        true, if the computation successfully finished or failed, false otherwise.

      • onComplete

        void onComplete(Consumer<? super Try<T>> action)
        Performs the action once the Future is complete. Does nothing if the Future is cancelled.
        Parameters:
        action - An action to be performed when this future is complete.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if action is null.
